intro: Andromeda canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian wintergreen, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its flowers, which bloom in late spring, are typically pink or white. Andromeda canadensis is also known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
